title: Clock how the world will celebrate October 21 - the date that Marty McFly visited in Back to the Future II
text:
View
comments
There have been more than a few hoax attempts over the past few years, but the big day is finally here - tomorrow is October 21, 2015, which is when Marty McFly and Doc Brown went into the future in Back To The Future II.
It is a moment in time that fans of the 80s film trilogy have been waiting years for.
As a result, around the world different countries are hosting their own Back To The Future events tomorrow, with everything from meet and greets with the cast to a chance to tour the original set at Universal Studios in California.
Tomorrow is October 21, 2015, the day when Marty McFly and Doc Brown went into the future in Back To The Future II
Several of the events are also fundraising for the Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson's Research.
While many of the parties are organised, others have unsurprisingly been masterminded by companies keen to cash in on the hype surrounding the cult film.

Everything from drinks to taxi businesses have jumped on the bandwagon by tying their products to the famous film.
MailOnline has picked out some of the best Back to The Future events taking place around the world tomorrow and later this week.
The Back To The Future trilogy made Michael J. Fox a global star. Several of the events happening this week are raising money for his Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson's Research
The Million McFly March, Burbank, California
Tomorrow, fans of the film are gathering at the first real-world location used in Back to the Future (The Burbank Burger King at 545 N Victory Blvd, Burbank, California 91502), dressed as Marty McFly.
They are aiming to amass the largest gathering of McFlys in history to help raise money for Parkinson's research.
They will be accompanied by bands and a raffle that is auctioning off signed photos of stars from the film, Back To the Future-inspired art and tickets to the premiere of the new Back to the Future documentary Back in Time.
Custom tour of the Universal Studios Backlot, California
In the Back To The Future sequel, Marty McFly and Doc Brown travel to 2015 to prevent McFly's future son from ending up imprisoned
Much of the movie was filmed at Universal Studios in California and as a result, they are hosting a custom tour of the backlot in celebration.
Fans will also see a screening of Back to the Future, Part II (with surprises) and a World Premiere Screening of the documentary 'Out Of Time: Saving the DeLorean Time Machine'.
They will also be able to see the fully restored, screen-used, Hero 'A' DeLorean Time Machine from the films.
Later in the week, the studios are continuing the celebrations by transforming a location near Burbank into Hill Valley, where people can attempt to ride a hoverboard and meet some cast from the film.
They are also hosting a filming locations tour of the real-life venues that featured in the film away from the studio lot.
Back To The Future Movie Night, The Brooklyn Bowl, The 02, North Greenwich
The Brooklyn Bowl are hosting a special screening of the film tomorrow night and have an 80s cover band in to help get visitors in the mood.
They're also giving away prizes for free food, drinks, bowling and gig tickets for those dressed in 80s attire.
Delorean Dynamite, Bussey Building, Peckham
Several events are also hosting an Enchantment Under The Sea Dance, which featured in the first film
Of course trendy Peckham is celebrating Back To The Future day.
On Friday, the Bussey Building is hosting a party that features music from 2015 on one floor and music from 1955 on another level with an Enchantment Under The Sea Dance.
Back To The Future film screening accompanied by live orchestra, various cities
Now, fans old and new can experience the Back To The Future film accompanied by a live orchestra.
They can watch the movie on a big high definition screen with a full symphony orchestra performing Alan Silverstri's dazzling musical score, live.
Twenty minutes of brand new music has also been added by composer Silvestri to the film's score especially for these unique live orchestra presentations.
The Film Concerts Live! company is touring this experience and it will be showing at the Hilbert Circle Theatre in Indianapolis tomorrow, but is also scheduled to be stopping in Melbourne, Perth, Dublin, Mexico City and Chicago.
Free taxi rides, New York
A scene from 1989 film 'Back to the Future II', starring Michael J. Fox and Christopher Lloyd
Taxi hailing company Lyft is offering free DeLorean rides tomorrow in New York city.
Customers can get a free trip by using a 'McFly Mode' special section on their app between 11am and 5pm.
Back To The Future Day Celebration At Mid-City Lanes Rock N Bowl, New York
Mid-City Lanes Rock N Bowl is being transformed into the set from the 'Enchantment Under The Sea Dance' for one night only.
A Huey Lewis and The News national touring tribute band are performing and there will be a Back To The Future quiz to find the ultimate fan.
There is also a fancy dress contest to find the best 'Biff', 'Marty' and 'Doc' on the night.
Drink a Pepsi Perfect, online
Pepsi Perfect was featured in the second Back To The Future film, when Marty visited 2015.
The drinks company are making 6,500 Pepsi Perfect bottles in a special collectible case and selling them online for $20.15, which is the same price that they sold for in the movie.
Back To The Future comedy night, Leicester Square Theatre, London
Back To The Future III saw the duo go back in time, but it didn't capture imaginations as much as the second film
Comedian Nathan Cassidy is performing an abridged version of his trilogy of stand-up shows on the Back To The Future films.
After a space-time continuum changing encounter with Doctor Emmett Brown, Nathan realises there is only one thing that has really changed over the last 30 years. It isn't flying cars. And it's about to ruin all of our lives.
He is performing the show at the Leicester Square Theatre tomorrow night.
